name: Arooj Fatima Tul Zahra
position: Vice President of Swinburne Postgraduate Research Society (2024)
institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus
location: Room A315, 3rd Floor, Building A, Jalan Simpang Tiga, 93350 Kuching, Sarawak, Malaysia
bio: Arooj Fatima Tul Zahra is a dedicated Biotechnology graduate specializing in environmental sciences, particularly in microplastics, DNA Stable Isotope Probing (SIP), and Microbial Plastics Interaction Experiments (mPIEs). She earned her Bachelor of Science in Biotechnology from Swinburne University of Technology, Kuching. Arooj has extensive experience as a Research Assistant with the Aquatic and Environmental Sciences AQUES Research Group. She conducted detailed analyses of Maludam River water samples, including measurements of various carbon compounds and greenhouse gases. Her work also involved collecting microplastic samples from Sarawak beaches to study their environmental impact.

name: Jonathan Lee Wen Han
institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus
bio: Jonathan’s research focuses on biohydrogen production using green microalgae, aiming to contribute to the viable upscaling or industrial scale of biohydrogen production, which is currently still in the research phase. He also has experience in agricultural science research related to biochar production from sago barks during his Final Year Research Project.

name: Clarence Tay
institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus
bio: Clarence’s research focuses on microplastics, aiming to develop a clearer picture of microplastic pollution in Southeast Asian coastal regions. His expertise includes microscopic techniques such as fluorescence microscopy and developing predictive models. He is also involved in community outreach programs to raise awareness of plastic pollution.

career_highlights.title: Master of Science (Research)
career_highlights.institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus

career_highlights.title: Bachelor of Science (Biotechnology)
career_highlights.institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus

publications.authors: Huda, F. R., Richard, F. S., Rahman, I., Moradi, S., Hua, C. T. Y., Wanwen, C. A. S., Fong, T. L., Mujahid, A., & Müller, M.
publications.title: Comparison of learning models to predict LDPE, PET, and ABS concentrations in beach sediment based on spectral reflectance.

name: Alwi Nurmadi Widyananda
institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus
bio: Alwi’s research focuses on using hyperspectral imaging for plastic detection in aquatic environments. He completed his Bachelor of Science (Biotechnology) and is now pioneering research with HydraSpectra sensors for potential expansion of water monitoring capabilities.

name: Christabel Anfield Sim Wanwen
institution: Swinburne University of Technology, Sarawak Campus
bio: Christabel’s research deals with the study of microplastic transport using the aid of modelling software to estimate the transport pathways of microplastics, to find out where they end up in our waters. Her study area is located at the Kuching Wetlands National Park (KWNP).

publications.authors: Huda, F. R., Richard, F.S., Rahman, I., Moradi, S., Tay, C.Y.H., Sim, C.A.W., Fong, T.L, Aazani Mujahid and Müller, M.
publications.title: Comparison of learning models to predict LDPE, PET, and ABS concentrations in beach sediment based on spectral reflectance.
